source.942a6f57:
import pandas as pd
data = pd.read_csv("../input/fremont-bridge/fremont-bridge.csv", index_col= 'Date', parse_dates=['Date'])
data.head()
source.94a1f2af:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
data.plot(figsize=(20, 4))
plt.grid()
plt.legend(loc='best')
plt.ylabel("Hourly Bicycle count")
plt.show()
source.10781360:
import seaborn
seaborn.set()
data.plot(figsize=(20,5))
plt.ylabel("Hourly Bicycle count")
plt.show()
source.2278bfef:
yearly = data.resample("Y").sum()
yearly.plot(style=[':', '--', '-'],figsize=(20,5))
plt.ylabel('Yearly bicycle count')
plt.show()
source.2860b6a9:
weekly = data.resample("W").sum()
weekly.plot(style=[':', '--', '-'],figsize=(20,5))
plt.ylabel('Weekly bicycle count')
plt.show()
source.2b051617:
daily = data.resample('D').sum()
daily.rolling(30, center=True).sum().plot(style=[':', '--', '-'],figsize=(20,5))
plt.ylabel('Mean Hourly Count')
plt.show()
source.883969b3:
daily.rolling(50, center=True,
              win_type='gaussian').sum(std=10).plot(style=[':','--', '-'],figsize=(20,5))
plt.ylabel('Mean Hourly Count')
plt.show()
source.7b5c2fce:
import numpy as np
by_time = data.groupby(data.index.time).mean()
hourly_ticks = 4 * 60 * 60 * np.arange(6)
by_time.plot(xticks= hourly_ticks, style=[':', '--', '-'],figsize=(20,5))
plt.ylabel("Traffic according to Time")
plt.show()
source.ba0f7027: Since, Missing value is quite less. So, we will drop NA
source.d40cb18a: Below data comes from an automated bicycle counter, installed in late 2012, which has inductive sensors on the east and west sidewalks of the bridge.
